newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: Lithuanian shares up in light trade, dealers split.
newsitem.headline: Lithuanian shares up in light trade, dealers split.

text.p: *Vilniaus Department Store active in block trades
Shares rose in light trade on Wednesday and the small turnover left brokers divided over whether Lithuania's stock exchange is coming out of the doldrums.
The official index rose 9.32 points to 930.76 points. Group A shares were up 24.83 points to 2,033.57 points.
"I don't see any strong trends that would lead to an increase of prices or trading," said Robertas Berzinskas, a broker with Vilniaus Bank brokerage house.
Turnover on the central market fell to 670,000 litas from 930,000 litas.
"I'm not pessimistic," said Grazina Bachiuliene, a broker with Vilfima.
"About two thirds or more of the companies on the A list had transactions today, although many of them were small," Bachiuliene said.
Vilniaus Bank shares rose to 240.00 litas from 232.00 litas on the central market, on turnover of 240,000 litas.
"I don't expect the price to be higher than 240.00 litas or 250.00 litas in the near future," Berzinskas said.

Hermis Bank shares slid to 178.00 litas from 180.00 on light turnover of almost 89,000 litas. Brokers see Hermis, which released positive results for the first four months of the year, as having rooom to grow.
"Compared to Vilniaus Bank, the price for Hermis is very low," said Arvydas Jacikevicius, a broker with Suprema.
In block trading, Vilniaus Department Store was active in turnvover of 420,000 litas at a price of 100.00 litas.
"It's not a good store, but it's in a good place," Bachiuliene said.
